result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jerry J Maney was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Present Sentence Defendant Is Serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision at the rate of $100.00 per month starting on the 5th month of Extended Supervision and thereafter.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Blood Test Reimbursement:  $25.00 to be through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Brookfield Police Department.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Disclose any prescriptions and sign a medical release.
No illegal substances.
No drugs or alcohol unless prescribed.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided.

Count #2 was Dismissed.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Present Sentence Defendant Is Serving.

superTimeConds.notes: Each year during Extended Supervision and the Last 20 hours of Community Service to be performed by the 10th month before the end of the year.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel Meeting within 90 days of release to Extended Supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry J Maney in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed by operation of law. Court will not order the Defendant to remain at the Waukesha County Jail. Court will authorize 2 phone calls for the defendant to Racine County Jail. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 4 1/2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 1/2 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years) consecutive to present sentence deft. is serving
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Earned Release Program
- 2 years Drivers License Revocation. 
- 2 years Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting within 90 days of release Extended Supervision
- Alcohol Assessment
- Fine totaling: $2277.00 to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month starting on the 5th month of Extended Supervision and thereafter 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Town of Brookfield Police Department - append to fine
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - append to fine
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety. Disclose any prescriptions and sign a medical release. No illegal substances. No drugs or alcohol unless prescribed.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. Perform 20 hours of community service each year during Extended Supervision and the last 20 hours of community service to be performed by the 10th month before the end of the year.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
letter from defendant for Court's consideration at sentencing filed by Attorney Carl Chesshir.
Defendant to remain in Waukesha County Jail until November 18, 2014.
